definition: pleased because you have achieved something or because something that you wanted to happen has happened
believing or accepting that something is true
doing something as a paid job rather than as a hobby
done as a paid job rather than as a hobby

showing that somebody is well trained and has a lot of skill
connected with the standards that are expected in a particular profession

art, music, literature, etc., thought of as a group

the growing of plants or producing of particular animals in order to get a particular substance or crop from them

the state of being clean or the habit of keeping things clean
a rule that deals with a particular crime, agreement, etc.
the whole system of rules that everyone in a country or society must obey

used to refer to the police and the legal system
the fact that something always happens in the same way in an activity or in nature

one of the rules that controls an organization or activity
a rule for good behaviour or how you should behave in a particular place or situation
to behave in an independent way and ignore rules or what other people want you to do
to ask a court to settle a problem or disagreement
a situation in which people obey the law and behave in a peaceful way
the principle that one thing will happen as often as another if you try enough times

to tell somebody with force what they should or should not do
the exact words of a law or rule rather than its general meaning
in trouble with the police
if you already have or control something, it is difficult for somebody else to take it away from you, even if they have the legal right to it
the condition in which all members of society, including its political leaders, accept the authority of the law
to do something illegal in order to punish somebody for doing something wrong, instead of letting the police deal with them
used to tell somebody who is criticizing you that you are not doing anything wrong

a large heavy animal with very thick skin and either one or two horns on its nose, that lives in Africa and Asia
a very small part of matter (= a substance). There are several types of quark and it is thought that protons, neutrons, etc. are formed from them.
a type of soft cheese from central Europe, similar to curd cheese
a sledge (= a vehicle that slides over snow), especially one pulled by horses

the ordinary people in society who are not leaders or who are considered to be not very well educated
the most; the majority
the quantity of material that something contains
to be full of or covered with something

the part of a large machine or vehicle that digs or moves earth

having the same origin as another word or language
related in some way and therefore similar
to become red in the face because you are embarrassed or ashamed
to be ashamed or embarrassed about something
to become red; to make something red

a small dark brown mark on the skin, sometimes slightly higher than the skin around it

a unit for measuring the amount of substance

if a building, etc. overlooks a place, you can see that place from the building

a large, wide, flat sea fish that has a long tail with a sharp sting in it that can cause serious wounds
a long speech made in a parliament in order to delay or prevent a vote
the act of changing the size and borders of an area for voting in order to give an unfair advantage to one party in an election
the ability to breathe, grow, produce young, etc. that people, animals and plants have before they die and that objects do not have
the state of being alive as a human; an individual person’s existence
living things
the period between somebody’s birth and their death; a part of this period
a period of somebody’s life when they are in a particular situation or job
the period of time when something exists or functions

the activities and experiences that are typical of a particular way of living

the quality of being active and exciting
the punishment of being sent to prison for life or a very long period of time; life imprisonment
a living model or a real object or scene that people draw or paint
a story of somebody’s life
one of a set number of chances before a player is out of a game
at the age you are (especially when you are not young)
be the most important person or thing to somebody
to improve something by introducing new ideas and making people more interested in it
an essential part of a person’s existence
to make somebody/something more interesting or exciting

to start to act or move as if alive

to spend the last part of your life in a particular state or place

feeling frightened that you might be killed

used to show surprise at seeing somebody/something
looking or behaving in a way that is more interesting or exciting than other people, and so is likely to attract attention

the chance to live or last longer, or with a better quality of life
the possibility or belief that people continue to exist in some form after they die

used to say that there is a situation in which it is not thought to be important if people somewhere die or are treated badly
seeming to move or function by itself without a person touching or working it
used to say that it is not worth wasting time doing something that you dislike or that is not important
the person somebody loves more than any other
to cause problems for somebody
to behave in a way that makes somebody else feel very unhappy

used to describe a situation that is very important or serious

used when you are disappointed about something but know that you must accept it

used to say that you are certain that something will happen
in the way that is usual or normal; most often
